result.execSummary:
The defendant GEORGE SHELTON JR was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. GEORGE SHELTON JR

records.addlTxt: 11:16 AM Defendant GEORGE SHELTON JR in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for GEORGE SHELTON JR.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.

8:44 AM   Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant GEORGE SHELTON JR in court.  Attorney Nicole A Morley in court for GEORGE SHELTON JR.   Complaint received.  Reading waived.  Victim present in court and requests "no contact" to be lifted.  State objects.  Court hears oral arguments.  Court denies request to modify bond and advises victim to contact the Christine Ann Center.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
